page.title: 06Compton Acres
page.content: } Compton Acres started soon after the First World War when the late Thomas William Simpson had the idea of laying out some wonderful gardens. It took five years of dedicated planing and the expenditure of about Â£220,000 before the gardens evolved. Rare plants, many tropical and sub-tropical and a priceless collection of bronze and marble statuary, lead figures and vases, many of them museum pieces, were collected from all over the world. The Japanese Garden is reputed to be the only completely genuine Japanese Garden in Europe. Japanese architects and workmen were brought over to England to construct this Garden.
